arm_group.description: the out of hospital cardiac arrest victims who were given bystander CPR by whom trained as newer BLS training program with dispatcher assisted CPR simulation.

brief_summary.textblock:
Despite aggressive CPR training, the outcome of cardiac arrest is not good. The problem is
      method of education. So, the investigators want to add the dispatcher-assisted CPR
      simulation into conventional CPR training. In this study, the investigators aim is to
      investigate the effect of newer CPR training program.

clinical_study.brief_title: Before and After Community Intervention Trial With Dispatcher Assisted CPR Program

detailed_description.textblock:
The training program focuses on working in team with dispatcher, performing all steps from
      recognizing cardiac arrest to performing CPR, together with the dispatcher. The one hours
      training session is split into four parts:

        1. Video self-instruction manikin practice (30 min), including a brief introduction to
           AED.

        2. Practice in pairs (15 min). Practicing the dispatcher and rescuer role in a simulation
           to enhance learning.

        3. Debriefing. Questions, answers and reflection (15 min).

        4. Homework. Leaflet with tasks like learn how to activate the speaker function on your
           own phone.

      The main difference between DA-BLS and traditional BLS training is that DA-BLS provides the
      scenes and interactive experiences on calling EMS and receiving CPR instruction via
      telephone speaker function, following up the skill training by scenario simulation training.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All OHCA patients with presumed cardiac etiology who are 15 years of age or older and
             assessed and treated by EMS providers after dispatched by the EMS dispatch center
             will be included.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  We will exclude patients with non-cardiac etiology, prolonged cardiac arrest with a
             suspected duration more than 30 minutes, cases such as livor mortis or rigor mortis,
             and decapitated or decomposed body, and patients who have "Do-Not-Resuscitate" card
             documented by doctor.

intervention.intervention_name: BLS CPR program with dispatcher assisted CPR simulation

clinical_study.official_title: Layperson Training of Dispatcher Assisted Basic Life Support for Improving Outcomes After Out-of-Hospital Cardiac Arrest; a Nonradomized before-and After- Community Intervention Trial

overall_official.last_name: Sang Do Shin, MD, MPH, PHD

primary_outcome.description: The study end points in phase 1 intervention is survival to admission. This will be measured as proportion of patients who were admitted with their spontaneous circulation recovered before admission from emergency department. This information will be collected from medical record review.

The study end points in phase 2 intervention are survival to discharge. Survival to discharge will be measured as proportions of patients who were discharged from a hospital with their spontaneous circulation recovered. This information will be collected from medical record review.
primary_outcome.time_frame: from date of discharge, assessed up to 3 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Bystander CPR rate will be measured as rate of bystander CPR given to the study subjects. This information will be collected from dispatch registry .
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from date of cardiac arrest occurred for each patient, assessed up 1 week

secondary_outcome.description: The pre-hospital return of spontaneous circulation will be measured as proportion of the patients who were recovered their circulation before arrival at emergency department. This information will be collected from our 119 run sheet.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from date of cardiac arrest occurred, assessed up to 1 week

secondary_outcome.description: The CPC score will be used to measure neurological recovery status. We defined the good neurological recovery as CPC 1 or CPC 2. This information will be collected from medical record review.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from date of discharge, assessed up to 3 months

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
